title: Bald Hills car crash kills two, causes delays on Gympie Arterial Rd
text:
Two people have died after a stolen car collided with another vehicle on Gympie Arterial Road in Bald Hills.

Two dead in crash involving stolen car at Bald Hills (7 News)

Two people have died in a traffic crash north of Brisbane overnight, causing delays to a major road.

Police say preliminary inquiries suggested a stolen car travelling north on Gympie Arterial Rd, Bald Hills, hit a car travelling south around midnight.

One person in each car died at the scene and another two are in hospital with serious and critical injuries.

The southbound lanes of Gympie Arterial Rd remain closed while Forensic Crash Unit officers investigate the crash.

All southbound traffic is being diverted onto the Gateway Motorway.

Queensland Ambulance Service Kedron Park Officer in Charge Matthew Meister said several ambulances raced to the scene of the accident.

“Upon arrival of the ambulance crews, they found four patients where sadly two of those patients had passed away on scene,” he said.

“The other two patients were transported — one to the Royal Brisbane Hospital in a serious and critical condition with multiple injuries, another was transported to the Princess Alexandra Hospital with moderate injuries.”
description: Two people have died in a traffic crash north of Brisbane overnight, causing delays to a major road.
